result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bear L. Schwittay

records.addlTxt:
1:42 PM Defendant Bear L. Schwittay in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Bear L. Schwittay.  Attorney Mitchell John Philbin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF256 and 22tr1118
Atty Hansen heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands.
Waives formal reading.
Requests prelim and waives time limits.
Court schedules with parties.
1:45 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:50 PM Defendant Bear L. Schwittay in court.  Attorney Mitchell John Philbin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF256 and 22TR1118.
ADA heard on charges.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - has not spoken to the Public Defender yet.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Deft to contact the Public Defender today.
Court schedules with parties.
ADA heard on bond recommendation.
Court imposes $2000 signature bond w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without valid Rx, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license.
1:53 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
